comments:
We've seen the following stack trace in the logs:

java.lang.NullPointerException
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager.computeNatureEnablements(NatureManager.java:50)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager.getEnabledNatures(NatureManager.java:332)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.NatureManager.isNatureEnabled(NatureManager.java:433)
    at org.eclipse.core.internal.resources.Project.isNatureEnabled(Project.java:730)

Looking at the code, the NPE is happening on this line:

...
String[] natureIds = project.internalGetDescription().getNatureIds();
...

The "internalGetDescription()" method will just return null if the ProjectInfo cannot be retrieved (and is meant to be used in use cases like project creation) - NatureManager should be checking for null here...
Is this somehow different from bug 166416?

My appologies. I don't know how I could have forgotten about the other bug.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 166416 ***
